pros: Management will take care of you if you prove you are a valuable employee. Being a rural area, it is hard to replace good workers and they know this.
cons: Location. It works for some, it doesn't work for others. Great place to raise a family, limited in terms of "things to do" for the adults.

pros: They try to accept other ethnic and cultural groups
cons: But they can over use their staff to the point of exhaustion. I can never work with regional hospitals again.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Hays, KS
pros: Good team work, pleasant environment
cons: Long hours, little pay, management hard to contact

review_title: I was fired for advocating for my patient
pros: My unit gave me so much experience on my resume, no one can ever take that away. I miss the friendship I had with my coworkers. I still take pride in my employment there. Opportunities to grow.
cons: Unit managers are worthless since the upper management makes major decisions for them without consult. I was terminated without warning and without explanation other than “making rude comments to staff”. My manager’s manager didn’t care to hear what I had to say. He gave vague, pre-canned, generic responses to my questions about it all. A year later I finally found out the truth, it was a male therapist who had a reputation for getting mad when he didn’t get his way. He went to the CNO after we disagreed on treatment for a patient, which is not the proper protocol, and I was denied any chance to discuss things with my manager. It’s all politics. I was punished over patient advocacy. Also, administration was pushing a cardiothoracic surgery service for financial gain knowing full well there were post-op problems.

review_title: Good place to work, work environment
pros: Work environment is fun and good. Benefits are average. Health Insurance leave much to desire.
cons: Pay is not competitive, if you ever get a raise you will fight tooth and nail to see the value compensation back. They will want you to give your life to them, however do not go out of their way for their core staff.
